Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Add test render functionality to verify Vulkan rendering pipeline

This commit implements a standalone test render feature that clears the screen
to cyan, allowing verification of the Vulkan rendering pipeline without needing
to load a game.

## Android UI Changes
- Add TestRenderScreen: New Compose screen with dedicated Vulkan surface
- Add test render button to LibraryScreen \(wrench icon in top bar\)
- Add test render option to GameScreen in-game menu
- Update App.kt navigation to include TestRender route
- Run test_render\(\) on background thread to prevent ANR

## Native Core Changes
- Add test_render\(\) method to Emulator and GPU classes
- Add nativeTestRender JNI binding
- Implement GPU::test_render\(\) to clear screen to cyan \(0.0, 1.0, 1.0\)
- Fix TextureCache initialization to use correct parameters \(max_size_mb\)
- Fix RenderTargetManager initialization to pass nullptr for EdramManager
- Fix CommandProcessor default shader hashes to use valid hex values
- Add LOGW macro for warnings in command_processor.cpp

## Build System
- Add missing source files to CMakeLists.txt:
  - src/gpu/buffer_pool.cpp
  - src/gpu/default_shaders.cpp

## Testing
Successfully renders cyan screen on physical Android device, confirming:
- Vulkan backend initialization works correctly
- Surface creation and presentation functional
- Command buffer execution working
- Frame management \(acquire/present\) operational

Improve XEX LZX decompression infrastructure

- Fix window_bits calculation to properly convert window size to bits
- Add LZX compression info parsing \(window_size, first_block_offset\)
- Match Xenia''s LZX decompressor parameters \(0x8000 input buffer\)
- Add support for parsing compression type 2 \(LZX\) header data

Note: LZX decompression still fails with MSPACK_ERR_DATAFORMAT.
Further investigation needed for proper block/chunk structure handling.
